answers.author: John Brooks
answers.text:
In a previous position we leased out as well. One thing I found out (at least in CA) was that although gov't agencies are exempt from property taxes, when a section of the building is leased to a for-profit entity then that part of the building is not exempt. So that needs to be factored into your analysis. You can lease to other governmental agencies and not trigger that provision. We also ended up hiring a property manager to handle the day-to-day tenant issues, so you may need to add that to your analysis. John Brooks
